questionsData.title: The concentration of nitrogen is measured on the pH scale.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The concentration of hydrogen is measured on the pH scale.  

The concentration of hydrogen ions (H+) is measured on the pH scale.
The pH scale indeed measures the concentration of hydrogen ions, not just "hydrogen" in general.  Hydrogen atoms can exist in different forms, but the pH scale specifically focuses on free-floating hydrogen ions (H+).

questionsData.title: Both liquids and gases are kept in closed containers.
questionsData.explain_answer: Both liquids and gases are typically kept in closed containers to prevent them from escaping or evaporating.

questionsData.title: The angle of incidence and reflection is the same on rough surfaces.
The sound of a jet plane taking off is stronger than the sound of people talking.
In the past the idea of vaccination was common.
The moon has many phases.
Apples are round in shape.
Lions are unusual animals.
"Chewing the cud" means "feed from the mother".
"To collapse "means "to have a normal health".
Scare and fear are synonyms.
A very large wood is a farm.
questionsData.explain_answer: A very large wood is called a forest.

questionsData.title: We use a thermometer to measure fever.
"Popular" means "To be known and famous".
Students in their last year in school are called school leavers.
Papayas are kinds of vegetables.
"Mixture" means "combination of many things".
Frozen peas are processed in houses.
"Pulling up the sail" means "putting it down".
Mutiny is to be against the rules.
The text is mainly talking about………. styles.
questionsData.article: Our minds and bodies (gather 1) information in different ways and from all around us: seeing, hearing and doing. Then our brain process that information, organize (it 3) and make connections to things we already know. This process can also work in different ways: Do we think in pictures or words? Do we (remember 2) details or big pictures? When we are trying to learn, it helps to know how our brain works. How do we best gather and organize information? Different people have different learning styles. For example, one person might struggle with written information but understand it immediately in an illustration. Another person might have problems with the pictures, but not the written text. Psychologists have identified some basic learning styles. Linguistics, learning by using language skills. Visual learning by seeing what they are learning. Interpersonal, learning by working with others. Intrapersonal, learning by associating new information directly with experience. Kinesthetic, learning by movement and physical activities. Eventually, you will often experience situations that do not match your learning  style. If you know what your strengths are, you can develop your own learning style to balance your weakness for a more successful experience.

questionsData.title: We don’t have….. time to finish the assignment.
The compound word is……
questionsData.explain_answer:
The compound word out of your options is not actually  Politely.

Compound words are formed by joining two or more words to create a new word with a new meaning.

Politeness is a noun that describes the quality of being polite.
Polite is an adjective describing someone or something that is courteous and respectful.
More polite is a phrase comparing levels of politeness.
Politely however, is an adverb formed by adding the suffix "-ly" to the adjective "polite". It describes how something is done in a polite way.

questionsData.title: The noun of "polite" is ……..
A suffix that changes the verb "reflect" into a noun
My friend always gets the ….scores.
Ahmed's hair is as …. as mine.
We are interested in …….English.
Elephants live in the forest…….there is a lot of grass and water.
……. the disease was dangerous, the doctors controlled it.
Deal ….. with those kids.
She never …… the answer.
Dana won't ….. the exams, because she didn't study well.
Sameer is ……of giving up his work.
After he ……university, he worked as a doctor.
Animals are ……..into families.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Animals are classified into families..

Here's why:

  • Classified is the past participle of the verb "classify," which means to arrange things into categories based on shared characteristics.
  • Classify and classifies are the present tense singular and plural forms of the verb, respectively. They wouldn't fit the sentence structure here.
  • Classifying is the present participle of the verb, indicating an ongoing action. The sentence talks about a completed action (animals are already grouped).
